channel.title: iTouch
channel.description: Hey if anyone here has an iTouch could you post the things you like and the things you don't like about it? I'm planning on buying one for Christmas but i was just wondering.

item.title: iTouch
item.dc:creator: @Xx_R_A_G_3_R Xx R A G 3 R
item.description:
@Xx_R_A_G_3_R wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:21, topic:251378”]You can turn an iTouch into an iPhone (without the camera) pretty easily.[/quote] Yea with the apps and everything iTouch and iPhones are pretty similiar, the screen really is a peice of work tho

item.title: iTouch
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“Xx R A G 3 R, post:16, topic:251378”][quote author=io9 link=topic=331800.msg2591349#msg2591349 date=1229781249]

I’ve heard about jailbreaking your itouch, doesnt that cancel the warranty on it though? and are the apps worth it for jailbreaking?

Nope, it doesn’t. The apps on in jailbroken “appstores” however, are more nerdesque.
Also, by pressing the recover button in iTunes, you can wipe it to a factory-new state, with no traces of jailbroken firmware and software, anywhere.
[/quote] Interesting, so jailbreaking an itouch is perfectly safe? supposing you know what your doing and don’t screw up[/quote]
You can fill the OS partition with “ASer293i450-i14ew jds235 wesfU((&$(8-1238 eruw0eiorjf0-98e=-98=9480q923980(+()Q*$)(*q23=09uewadjALSNd,.ANSdAsdoicxkn0p293q-0rwe plsdf,xvm q4[w0dpoclv” and still be able to bring it back to a brand new state, yes.

Read full topic

item.title: iTouch
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:6, topic:251378”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=331800.msg2589978#msg2589978 date=1229720337]

im getting one for crimbo im looking to crack it asap

Jailbreaking the iTouch doesn’t really add much to it.
[/quote]i want to be able to get apps without paying for them, and the fact that its a fairly interesting peice of kit. If there is a possibility that i can install a verison of linux on the touch that is something worth doing[/quote]

Most of the apps in the app store aren’t available in the jailbreak “store”.
And the linux is still in the works.

Read full topic

item.title: iTouch
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

I suppose yeah, The people around where i’m living (Ireland) are a bit scared of breaking it though, They wouldn’t really know about being able to Recover it.

It is also a waste of money yeah, There are a few people in my school offering to do it,
But i doubt they get any people, Although the Phone-cover seller get’s a few people.

Read full topic

item.title: iTouch
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“si force, post:10, topic:251378”][quote author=io9 link=topic=331800.msg2590241#msg2590241 date=1229729849]

If your going to Jailbreak an iPod, Get it done professionaly done, My friend did it without doing this, And since he did do it, His ipod broke.

Unless you know how to do it and the method was used before successfuly.

Yano, you can’t exactly brick and iPod no matter how hard you try. There’s always the “restore” function in iTunes, and there’s a hardware-based recovery mode in the iTouch.

Also, it’s pretty much illegal to have it professionally done, since it violates Apple’s EULA…
[/quote]

I suppose it’s easy to Fix, And theres a ‘Phone-cover’ shop, Which obviously sells phone covers,
But they also offer $50 to JailBreak iPods,

So would the police just be able to go and shut them down?[/quote]
Noes, Apple would have to sue them.
Also, why waste 50$ to jailbreak an iTouch, if, assuming you can read and have a brain, you can do it yourself in five minutes using WinPwn?

Read full topic

item.title: iTouch
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:9, topic:251378”][quote author=si force link=topic=331800.msg2590224#msg2590224 date=1229729277]
If your going to Jailbreak an iPod, Get it done professionaly done, My friend did it without doing this, And since he did do it, His ipod broke.

Unless you know how to do it and the method was used before successfuly.
[/quote]
Yano, you can’t exactly brick and iPod no matter how hard you try. There’s always the “restore” function in iTunes, and there’s a hardware-based recovery mode in the iTouch.

Also, it’s pretty much illegal to have it professionally done, since it violates Apple’s EULA…[/quote]

I suppose it’s easy to Fix, And theres a ‘Phone-cover’ shop, Which obviously sells phone covers,
But they also offer $50 to JailBreak iPods,

So would the police just be able to go and shut them down?

Read full topic

item.title: iTouch
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“si force, post:7, topic:251378”]If your going to Jailbreak an iPod, Get it done professionaly done, My friend did it without doing this, And since he did do it, His ipod broke.

Unless you know how to do it and the method was used before successfuly.[/quote]
Yano, you can’t exactly brick any iPod no matter how hard you try. There’s always the “restore” function in iTunes, and there’s a hardware-based recovery mode on every iPod.

Also, it’s pretty much illegal to have it professionally done, since it violates Apple’s EULA…

Also, @sanga, the iTouch already runs Darwin, a UNIX derivative, and can run any POSIX-compliant app compiled to ARM-Darwin. Of course, you’ll need to jailbreak it and install the Terminal app from Cydia/Installer.

Also ask Rictoo, he knows more than I do.

Read full topic

item.title: iTouch
item.dc:creator: @stormcutter stormcutter
item.description:
@stormcutter wrote:

I have one and it’s pretty good. It’s better than the regular ipod, since you can go on the internet and watch movies. Jailbreaking really isn’t useful, since they added the app store to it.
